Core package¶

This page documents the core package (structures, conveyors and creators).

Note

These pages use autodoc to pull docstrings from the source. If your environment lacks graphical dependencies (e.g. pygame), consider mocking them in conf.py before building the docs.

Conveyor implementation.

This module provides Conveyor, a lightweight structure that transports numeric items between other structures using an internal queue.

The conveyor stores items as dictionaries with value and position keys where position progresses from 0.0 to 1.0 during transmission.

class core.conveyor.Conveyor(start_pos, end_pos, gameManager, speed=1)¶

Bases: Structure

Conveyor belt that transports numbers between structures.

start_pos, end_pos

Pixel coordinates for the conveyor endpoints.

Type:

pg.Vector2

queue¶

Items waiting on the belt. Each item is a dict with value and position (0.0..1.0).

Type:

collections.deque

travel_time¶

Time in milliseconds required for an item to travel the full belt.

Type:

float

connectOutput(conveyor)¶

Convenience to set the conveyor output.

createIterator()¶
draw()¶

Render the conveyor and the queued item values on screen.

isEmpty()¶
isReady()¶

Return True if an item is positioned at the conveyor end.

property output¶
peek()¶

Return the value at the front of the queue without removing it.

pop()¶

Remove and return the value at the end of the belt if ready.

push(number)¶

Enqueue a number at the start of the conveyor.

size()¶
update()¶

Advance item positions based on the game delta time and move items to the next conveyor when they reach the end.

class core.conveyorCreator.ConveyorCreator¶

Creator para cintas transportadoras. Requiere dos posiciones: inicio y fin.

createStructure(start_pos, gameManager, end_pos=None)¶

Crea una cinta transportadora entre dos puntos. start_pos: posición inicial (puede ser tuple de grid o pg.Vector2 de píxeles) end_pos: posición final (puede ser tuple de grid o pg.Vector2 de píxeles)

Costo base de construir una cinta

Return type:

int

Merger module: takes two inputs and merges them into one output.

This module provides the MergerModule class which combines items from two input conveyors and forwards them to a single output conveyor. Docstrings here describe behavior only; implementation is unchanged.

class core.mergerModule.MergerModule(position, gameManager)¶

getSpritePreview()¶

Mine structure.

Implements Mine, a producer structure that emits numbers at a fixed production interval. The class stores both grid and pixel coordinates and renders itself on the game surface.

class core.mine.Mine(position, number, gameManager)¶

A Mine that produces numeric values into an output conveyor.

Parameters:

  • position (tuple[int,int]) – Grid coordinates (x, y) where the mine will be placed.

  • number (int) – Base numeric value produced by this mine (upgrades may change the effective value).

  • gameManager (object) – Reference to the GameManager instance used for timing and rendering.

connectOutput(conveyor)¶

Connect a conveyor to this mine’s output.

draw()¶

Render the mine and the current number on screen.

produce(conveyor)¶

Push the mine’s value into the provided conveyor.

Uses an upgraded effective value when available.

update()¶

Periodic update called from the main loop (placeholder).

class core.mineCreator.MineCreator¶
createStructure(position, number, gameManager)¶
getSpritePreview()¶

Base module class used by operation modules (sum, mul, div, etc.).

This module defines Module, a convenience subclass of Structure that places common behaviour and drawing for modules used in the game grid.

class core.module.Module(position, gameManager)¶

Generic module base class.

Subclasses should override calcular() to implement their specific operation.

calcular()¶

Compute the module-specific operation. Subclasses must override.

draw()¶

Draw the module as a circle on the game surface.

getCost()¶

Optional: return module build cost.

update()¶

Per-frame update (placeholder in base class).

class core.operationModule.OperationModule(position, gameManager)¶

Splitter module: routes items from a single input to two outputs.

The SplitterModule alternates which output conveyor receives each item. This file contains only documentation additions; implementation is left unchanged.

class core.splitterModule.SplitterModule(position, gameManager)¶
connectInput(conveyor)¶
connectOutput1(conveyor)¶
connectOutput2(conveyor)¶
draw()¶

Render the structure on screen.

property input¶
property output1¶
property output2¶
process()¶

Splits numbers from input alternating between two outputs

update()¶

Advance internal state once per frame.

Sprite loading helpers for assets.

Provides a small utility to load and scale images from the project’s Assets/Sprites folder. The function returns a pygame.Surface or None if loading fails.

core.sprite_loader.load_sprite_from_assets(filename, size=(40, 40))¶

Load a sprite from Assets/Sprites and scale it to size.

Returns a pygame.Surface or None if the file is not found or loading fails. Errors are caught and logged as warnings to avoid breaking the game flow during startup.

Parameters:

filename (str)

Base structure abstraction used across core modules.

Subclasses must implement update() and draw(). This module defines the minimal interface consumed by the rest of the game logic.

class core.structure.Structure¶

Abstract base class for all placeable structures (mines, modules, etc.).

abstractmethod draw()¶

Render the structure on screen.

getCost()¶

Return the build cost for this structure (optional).

Subclasses may override to provide cost information used by builders.

abstractmethod update()¶

Advance internal state once per frame.

class core.structureCreator.StructureCreator¶
createStructure(x, y, gameManager)¶
getCost()¶
Return type:

int

getSpritePreview()¶

Sum module: consumes two inputs and produces their sum.

Defines SumModule which reads from two input conveyors, adds the values and pushes the result to an output conveyor.

getSpritePreview()¶

Well (pozo) structure: consumes numbers and awards points.

This module implements the Well structure used by the game. A Well consumes numeric items pushed by conveyors and awards points when the consumed number matches rules (multiples, difficulty-based bonuses). Only documentation and docstrings are added; implementation is unchanged.

class core.well.Well(position, consumingNumber, gameManager, locked=False)¶
Parameters:

locked (bool)

connectInput(conveyor)¶

Permite que el sistema de reconexión conecte una cinta al pozo

draw()¶

Render the structure on screen.

Permite que un conveyor empuje un número directamente al pozo
